channel.title: CVE Feed for StoreApps -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for StoreApps -- all products

item.title: CVE-2022-25649|2024-08-03T04:42:50.632Z -- storeapps -- affiliate%20for%20woocommerce%20%28wordpress%20plugin%29
item.description: Multiple Improper Access Control vulnerabilities in StoreApps Affiliate For WooCommerce premium plugin <= 4.7.0 at WordPress.

item.title: CVE-2022-36284|2024-08-03T10:00:04.224Z -- storeapps -- affiliate%20for%20woocommerce%20%28wordpress%20plugin%29
item.description: Authenticated IDOR vulnerability in StoreApps Affiliate For WooCommerce premium plugin <= 4.7.0 at WordPress allows an attacker to change the PayPal email. WooCommerce PayPal Payments plugin (free) should be at least installed to get the extra input field on the user profile page.

item.title: CVE-2022-40694|2024-08-03T12:21:46.449Z -- storeapps -- news%20announcement%20scroll%20%28wordpress%20plugin%29
item.description: Auth. (admin+) Stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in News Announcement Scroll plugin <= 8.8.8 on WordPress.

item.title: CVE-2023-5663|2024-03-13T15:27:11.281Z -- storeapps -- news%20announcement%20scroll
item.description: The News Announcement Scroll plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to SQL Injection via the plugin's shortcode in versions up to, and including, 9.0.0 due to insufficient escaping on the user supplied parameter and lack of sufficient preparation on the existing SQL query. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with contributor-level and above permissions to append additional SQL queries into already existing queries that can be used to extract sensitive information from the database.

item.title: CVE-2023-5663|2024-08-02T08:07:32.463Z -- storeapps -- news%20announcement%20scroll
item.description: The News Announcement Scroll plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to SQL Injection via the plugin's shortcode in versions up to, and including, 9.0.0 due to insufficient escaping on the user supplied parameter and lack of sufficient preparation on the existing SQL query. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers with contributor-level and above permissions to append additional SQL queries into already existing queries that can be used to extract sensitive information from the database.
